translated: As It Was Said
The Threes
The fourth sub-chapter
Devadatta

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One:

original: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave asat dhammehi abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ devadattaḥ āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ kappaṭṭhaḥ atekiccho
translated: “Devadatta, overcome by three unwholesome things, with a mind obsessed by them, has gone to the plane of misery, to hell, to the Screaming Hell, and will remain there for the eon, incurable.

original: Katamehi tīhi?🔽Pāpicchatāya, bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
analyzed: katamehi tīhi  pāpicchatāya bhikkhave abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ devadattaḥ āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ kappaṭṭhaḥ atekiccho
translated: By which three?🔽By evil wishes, bhikkhus, Devadatta, overcome by evil wishes, with a mind obsessed by them, has gone to the plane of misery, to hell, to the Screaming Hell, and will remain there for the eon, incurable.

original: Pāpamittatāya, bhikkhave, abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho.
analyzed: pāpa mitta tāya bhikkhave abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ devadattaḥ āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ kappaṭṭhaḥ atekiccho
translated: By evil friends, bhikkhus, Devadatta, overcome by evil friends, with a mind obsessed by them, has gone to the plane of misery, to hell, to the Screaming Hell, and will remain there for the eon, incurable.

original: Sati kho pana uttarikaraṇīye oramattakena visesādhigamena antarā vosānaṁ āpādi.
analyzed: sati kho pana uttari karaṇīye oramattakena visesa adhigamena antarā vosānam āpādi
translated: And there is still more to be done. He has come to the end of the journey with only a little development.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi asaddhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho atekiccho”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi asat dhammehi abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ devadattaḥ āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ kappaṭṭhaḥ atekiccho ti
translated: Devadatta, bhikkhus, overcome by these three unwholesome things, with a mind obsessed by them, has gone to the plane of misery, to hell, to the Screaming Hell, and will remain there for the eon, incurable.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in this connection it was said:
“May no one in the world ever be
and evil wishes arose in him.
By this you may know
the destiny of those with evil wishes.
He was known as wise,
and considered developed,
his fame spread like water,

analyzed: devadatto ti vissuto  saḥ samāna manuciṇṇaḥ  āsajja nam tathāgata
translated: and he was renowned as Devadatta.🔽He, having gone forth,🔽attacked the Realised One,
and fell into Avīci Hell,

analyzed: catu dvāram bhayānaka  a duṭṭhassa hi yaḥ
translated: the fearful four-doored one.🔽For one who is not angry
but does a bad deed,
that bad deed will touch him,
the one with a corrupt mind, the disrespectful one.
One who thinks to pollute
the ocean with a pot of poison,
will not pollute it,
for the ocean is vast and cool.
In the same way, one who harms
the Realised One with words,
who is on the right path, with a peaceful mind,

original: vādo tamhi na rūhati.🔽Tādisaṁ mittaṁ kubbetha,
analyzed: vādaḥ tamhi na rūhati  tādisam mittam kubbetha
translated: the words do not take effect.🔽One should make such a friend,
and the wise one should attend on him,
following whose path the monk
will reach the end of suffering.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Fortunate One, so I have heard.
The tenth.
The fourth sub-chapter is finished.🔽The summary:
The sound of the respect for thoughts,
the foulness in the world of death;
The stain of the darkness of the Dhamma,
these ten were spoken of by Devadatta.
